TopicTitle: cBBp SPC Pack v0.4: Fixed Failcan RCS and added some adapter pieces. Enjoy.

Articles.Content: lol yu ean like an Ann225?
I wasn\'t thinking of that, but it does look like what I\'m envisioning.

Anyway modelling the inner tanks in a way that shows their design makes the whole thing come to realixation that it is just a big fat flying f of a fuel tank that can fly. If i just made it a smooth wall that attached to other walls i feel this fact of flying f tank would not be conveyed.

PS. these where fun to model. Got to learn a few more modelling techniques.
That is a lot of fuel.

That is a lot of fuel.

It uses a lot

I think it will be just enoguh to get it into sub orbit then RCS can be used to get it into the rest of the orbit. like the real shuttle. (depending on orbit desired and weight lifted)

Speaking of that. how much should this bugger be able to haul to orbit?

Speaking of that. how much should this bugger be able to haul to orbit?

A single ream of paper.

Speaking of that. how much should this bugger be able to haul to orbit?

The Venturestar would have carried about 1/50 of it\'s mass as payload-maybe try and achieve a similar ratio, assuming that it doesn\'t have ridiculous results in game.
care to transalte it into kerbal weights like how much kerbal weight would it be venture start wise.
It would be in kilograms, but I don\'t know the weight or the scaling ratio to use.
Hmm. seems that there is room in the bugger for a 1 meter cargo bay. but. i think i will not add one too much work 1 meter is boring.

As for the windows, I like the second one, I have the same opinion as Spoot Knight. It would be interesting to see how does it look like with a raised cockpit. I had no idea you were making the fuel tanks, they\'re cool and I like the idea to assemble the craft like this.

Hey, I\'m probably pretty late to this party, but do you plan on doing any kind of landing gear/further parts for the Durgun vehicle?

You\'re a very talented designer, and I can see alot of potential for this parts pack.

Do you plan on doing any kind of landing gear/further parts for the Durgun vehicle?

I remember saying something about implementing that when we get animated parts.

Got most fo the interior stuff modeled. it should make the crashing and falling aparts more interesting. Also, the fuel tank might just be usable else where if you can stand all the weird brakets on it lol. but i think each brake point will be an attach node.

Hope we don\'t get too many crybabies trying to run a CPU intensive game on a calculator.

High poly counts are good people.

Hope we don\'t get too many crybabies trying to run a CPU intensive game on a calculator.

High poly counts are good people.

it really isn\'t that high. they are all three sided. if you can fly the durgun and failcan this will be far less polies lol. (not including the engines)

Got most fo the interior stuff modeled. it should make the crashing and falling aparts more interesting. Also, the fuel tank might just be usable else where if you can stand all the weird brakets on it lol. but i think each brake point will be an attach node.

Looking great! I love how you have to assemble it first.
lol. well ho else would it work? kerbal doesn\'t support combined parts lol.
So great

hmm. i slaiced it up a good bit today. I need to work ona few things still. i need to figure out those body flaps and fix the back up a bit since it has been largly ignored.

I have no idea how I am going to do the collision boxes lol.
just need to to the back body flaps now and then I guess it is onto UV wrapping 0_O I made alot of progress today i suppose.
Hawtness.

Hawtness.

Oh i know right?
I am always gonna fly that thing with the top of the fuselage off. Looks too cool to cover.

Looks great. It\'s good to see how this whole thing is getting shape. If you\'ll manage to make the flight values this good as well, this is going to be one of the epicest mods in KSP (just kidding, this is epic already ).
